text: Well guys, I went 3-3 yesterday, finished 10-5 at the GP but I got my first career pro point in my first ever GP. And it was a freaking blast. And the food was on point as well. Louisville's food scene was so much better than I anticipated.
Congrats! That's pretty cool
Discussion: which would be cooler as a pauper build, Meren or Mazirek?
Mazirek. No one builds Mazirek
I think Meren is already popular enough. Mazirek would be sweet because it's way underrated
You can’t do either in Pauper, though, right?
I have my Mazirek list in my first article...
But I agree nobody else builds him
No one read your article, Dom
Accurate
I must have read it though, since I hired you
It wasn't there in the version I sent you
do you think people would be pissed if we moved from a deck url pasting -> a form that you copy/pasted your deck list into?
I think people will be pissed if you change something even if the end result is something better
its not better necessarily but easier for me for sure
Magic players always gotta complain.

I think it depends on how the deck needs to be formatted. If I'm someone who puts decks on Tapped Out, then the workflow would be:
1.) Open deck on Tapped Out
2.) Hit "Edit Deck" and copy list, or download as text and copy that
3.) Potentially have to reformat the list
4.) Paste into EDHREC

As opposed to:
1.) Open deck on Tapped Out
2.) Copy URL
3.) Paste into EDHREC

So the current mode never needs you to leave your browser, and definitely requires fewer actions; maybe significantly fewer, depending on how well the text field can understand different deck list formatting
What are the pros of having them paste a deck list instead?

Advantages:
- don’t need to keep fixing deckstats, tappedout issues as things change. I.e., tappedout changing their json, it seems like deckstats changed from using a sideboard card to actually having a commander section. Also, I think something else is busted with partners but i can’t figure it out with the time that i have right now.
- opens it up to pasting lists from other places other than tappedout and deckstats
Downsides:
- we don’t know where the decks come from. Before this was important because we stored the deck URL to determine which deck it is, but now it’ll be anonymous
- people may see this as inconvenient? idk i think i might like this better
Ah, okay
Making site maintenance easier on you sounds like a pretty big plus
yeah i mean i guess deckstats pasting vs. deckstats straight up not working is an improvement, right?
I keep local lists and online lists, but it would be pretty convenient for people who don't post their lists online
Hehe, yup, definitely
With all that taken into account, I say go for it
no preference either way, I vote whatever makes the cite easier to manage
I would say that the point of building a pauper deck is to build something in a different way than normal, so the Meren deck would be set apart from others that way
He means that you can't have a rare as your commander in pauper EDH
which is why I included it, unique prospective
yeah ok ok, then you basically can't build EDH in pauper
so Disregarding that
“pauper edh” as a format is any uncommon creature (doesnt have to be legendary) and then all common 99
ive seen people have many variations on it
but thats the most common one ive seen
oh
that's not what I wnat
cause I want an actual legend
with the 99 cards being pauper legal
that'd make it more like edh in the sense that the decks and archtypes are more normalized, but the card pool is restricted
is that crazy?
My issue with commons only is there are no boardwipes, I've tried pauper edh and that led to a lot of stalled boards
huh
interseting
that makes sense, oh well
I've played a bunch of Pauper EDH, I think it mostly needs to be a 1v1 format
I arranged a small League over the summer, weekly 1v1 matches, 35 life, 18 Commander damage, some banned Commanders
It's quite a bit of fun
My definition of PEDH is what Don described: common or uncommon creature as Commander, deck is all commons
The lack of boardwipes is definitely what makes it problematic for multiplayer, in my opinion
That said, preliminary results indicate that it's fun and semi-functional if you throw Planechase into the mix
Planechase Pauper Commander is part of the reason I have four PDH decks
in case anyone isn't already looking at it
<http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/news/january-9-2017-banned-and-restricted-announcement-2017-01-09>
Woah
Yea man. I'm fine with that.
This is insanity
I was kind of hoping it would be cathartic reunion getting the hammer out of dredge, but whatever.
didn’t realize Reflector Mage was such a terror in Standard...
(but I don’t pay much attention to it, really)
that's a huge overhaul...
Yeah - keeping Aetherworks Marvel, but jettisoning Emmy
The Grave-Troll almost seems like they were looking for an excuse - why not ban Cathartic Reunion?
...or idk, Narcomoeba?
<@U3L7A68JC> also because Cathartic is a common, that has plenty of applicability outside broken strategies, and only enables them, it isn't the core issue
but idk modern, maybe you're just right
I know less about Modern than Standard, so by no means am I ‘right’, I’m just trying to follow their presented logic
I can see why grave troll was axed but I do think cathartic reunion was the card that really pushed it over the edge
Maybe they want to keep it in the format but just make it a little weaker
Narcomoeba getting banned would make the deck unplayable, not being able to get the amalgam would make the deck infinitely worse and likely unplayable again
Definitely
I think so. If you take away reunion they go back to faithless looting which is still very good but much more fair and doesn't let them turn 2 fart out 20 power or silly things like that
Yea, I understand why any of those would be ban worthy. Troll had the biggest dredge count along with being the best late game fatty to play too
Just my thoughts on the process, but I can see why they chose the way they did
well, have fun debating this, Imma go play with my new toys *picks up Sram and Effecient Construction*

We don't have discussion forums or anything right now, If you guys wouldn't mind commenting on each other's articles and checking your articles a few times in between publications so that we engage with readers and encourage them to comment, that would be great.
I'm not saying you haven't been, I'm saying keep it up and do even more.

damn young whippersnappers i have full playsets of zendikar fetches because i was playing standard at the time

how do I say all I think should be banned is PoK and the "ante/dexterity/un/subgame" cards in the most assertive way?
the banned list is bullshit, fuck you, fight me?
maybe without the ? at the end...
Sam is on the ban list
maybe play vintage instead
I take a nap and everyone starts throwing some strong opinions.
it's not that I think vintage is great
I just think that we, as a format, are self-regulatory enough, to not need it
but seriously
why do we need half the banned list?
PoK was an EDH specific problem
and deserved a ban
same with maybe Sundering Titan, PT, and Sylvan Primordial
everything else is anecdotal at best
(sorry Emrakul could be on there too)

different playgroups may be self-regulatory but having a banlist gives some groups common ground so you have the ability to play EDH with one group and not have your deck be “banned” or “unplayable” with another group
I think from the RC’s perspective, everything on the banlist deserves it due to EDH power level
some of them, also due to price

I think that even though lots of playgroups can self regulate for the most part, 99.9% of playgroups don't know much about managing a format and need someone to give a forceful suggestion in a certain direction. I don't know crap about managing a format, and even though I know I personally don't agree with what the RC decides all the time, I do know they are better with the format than I am so I just defer to what they go with.
I do wish the RC were more transparent
<@U28TLDP0R>: I agree there for sure.
but it’s just a product of how EDH was born
also #unban #balance
white needs a buff, right? Kappa

But I'm not arguing they dont produce a banned list, I'm arguing that cards like Sway of the Stars don't have any reason for being banned other than "we don't like the potential to reset a game" similarly cards like Necropotence aren't banned while Balance is
I would play the hell out of some balance. Tajic would eat that stuff up
I think there's a difference between having a banned list that's 1/3 legacy 1/3 vintage 1/3 EDH
And one that's 100% EDH
my point was that you can argue it is 100% EDH
and I believe that to be the RC’s stance
$ is not part of the consideration for what makes a good format. It shouldn't be

To that point I think their reasoning might be(big might and this is just my interpretation) that why would you want to "reset" the game when you can just win the game and play another game entirely. It eliminates the feeling of being stuck in one situation and one long dreary game.
I would agree for competitive formats
It's their stance because some cards have just always been part of the banned list
but also, I said “everything” is banned for power level
If that is indeed where they are coming from I'm fine with that. I would rather play 4 30-minute games than one 2 hour game that drags on from cards like that.
Ok
I know I could totally be wrong, that's just a personal preference
Im curious - what's on the ban list that has effects you can't reproduce with other cards?
not sure how you would define an effect being reproducible by another card
I think most effects are just at a way less efficient rate. Upheaval could be capsize but requires infinite mana first etc
IOW, what do you need on the banlist?
What's IOW, I'm too old for this apparently
In other words

idk, ban lists are really subjective.  there are a bunch of different incentives: diversifying the format, making games “fun” or “not awful", shaking up a “solved” format, selling product, quieting down people who complain on forums.  and it’s always up for debate which of these matter and how you define them
<@U3L7A68JC>: Painter's Servant! As far as I know, nothing else replicates an effect like it
I know it combos with Grindsone / Iona, but it also allows for silly color hacky things
<@U286Q175Y> : I downsized a lot of decks so Mimeoplasm has been my only deck the last few months. But I recently added Oloro and Grenzo, HR.
There are other cards that change the color of permanents, but let’s face it - most folks would use it for Iona
Nothing does it so widely, like for the whole field for that long. I would rather ban Iona and Grindstone, since I think the Servant allows for new gameplay
I can get behind that idea.
effects that lock me out don’t bother me too much
but it all depends on the power level the group is playing at imo

I feel like most complaints I’ve seen are products of assholes with competitive decks crushing average decks simply because they chose to bring their best deck and didn’t care to be like “hey should I play my best deck or my average deck?"
so banning things like Iona, or hermit druid or what have you
to me it’s just like, whatever, they’ll find the next thing

I do personally like a much more self-policing meta
I should clarify, I don’t mean “nothing should be banned"
like Prophet was interesting because it crushed casual/average tables
but it was barely a thing at competitive tables
so that could be a case where it’s causing a big problem for a lot of players

ah, I mean I just think simic is the best and prophet made it 200% more miserable to play against
Well yeah. Simic is among the best.
Not to mention prophet doesn't get to migrate out of simic like the other great blue and green cards their decks play
I also think that Simic is the most powerful multicolor, with its access to highly flexible removal and card advantage
